text:
" omg" ... finally somebody who understands my need and cares as much... after a full 1 year review and insta follow, i finally made it to " strivenii".....
" calm zone" is what you get on entering.. no jarring music, no buzzing talks... just calm and tranquility....
started with making an appointment, the person who took the call was very polite and accomodating... i was running late because of the great mumbai traffic, yet when i reached there, i was received with a big smile and much warmth.
now with regards to the services and performance....i had an appointment for skin and hair.. basically what we women do üôÇ. my skin texture was checked,  and then i was suggested accordingly... no forcefully sales or products or anything. cost wise it is reasonable and pocket friendly.
the facial was done to perfection.... pedicure  and manicure was a big " wow" just the way i like my feet and hands to be ( no cuts or bruises).... the massage along with it was mind blowing...
i got my hair cut, coloured and botox treatment done the next day. my hair texture was checked, colour suggest accordingly to my skin tone... during the entire process, evryone was involved,
end result.. " truly pampered" and definitely " satisfied".

a big " thank you" to
ms. sangitaa - ( the insta icon), ms. parvati ( ms. sangitaa' s mom - she was so sweet kept asking about comfort) ms. damini, ms.priti, ms.tanuja, ms. kashish, ms.rupa,

you guys are absolutely " fantastic".

i followed all their aftercare instructions and used the recommended shampoo and hair mask‚Äîbut instead of helping, they made the condition even worse. my hair was in far better shape before the treatment.

what‚Äôs even more frustrating is that i paid over ‚Çπ13,000 for this damaging experience. i trusted the professionals here with my hair and ended up with severe hair damage instead. i strongly advise others to think twice before opting for any chemical treatments at this salon.

address: Unit No S/12, No 462, 2, Phoenix Mall, Senapati Bapat Marg, Lower Parel, Mumbai, Maharashtra 400013, India
text:
we visited lakme salon at palladium mall for two pedicures and an oil massage. one pedicure was good, but the second‚Äîdone by the same staff member‚Äîwas rushed and less effective. it seemed like the therapist was tired, which may point to an understaffing issue. experience delivered was inconsistent.

i did not like their pricing logic. they claimed only ‚Äúsenior stylists‚Äù were available for all services‚Äîincluding a simple men‚Äôs haircut‚Äîwould be charged ‚Çπ650 instead of the ‚Çπ400 advertised with a regular stylist. it felt like an upselling tactic, not a service choice.

we also paid ‚Çπ850 for an oil head massage that was rate-printed for ‚Çπ800 (!) and lasted barely 20 minutes. it didn‚Äôt justify the price. the experience was underwhelming compared to other salons that offer better, higher-quality massages with proper equipment and technique.

overall: inconsistent quality, inflated pricing, and little value for money. not an experience i‚Äôd recommend or repeat.
author: V

address: Unit No S/12, No 462, 2, Phoenix Mall, Senapati Bapat Marg, Lower Parel, Mumbai, Maharashtra 400013, India

place_name: LAKME SALON For Him & Her in HIGH STREET PHOENIX
address: Unit No S/12, No 462, 2, Phoenix Mall, Senapati Bapat Marg, Lower Parel, Mumbai, Maharashtra 400013, India
text:
extremely disappointing experience! ruined my long beautiful hair!

sadiq, who was introduced as the salon‚Äôs ‚Äúdesigner‚Äù (ie top stylist), completely ruined my long, beautiful hair. despite repeatedly and clearly instructing him from the beginning not to cut more than 2‚Äì3 inches, he went ahead and chopped off 10-12 inches, reducing my length by half.

he was dismissive of my inputs throughout and seemed more interested in doing what he wanted than listening to the client. it honestly felt like i was a lab experiment for him to practice on, not a paying customer.

to make matters worse, he couldn‚Äôt tell the difference between curly-wavy hair and frizz, and seemed unaware of how the curly girl method (cgm) works. also, he kept denying that he didn‚Äôt cut the hair short and it‚Äôs still long enough. if a hair stylist can‚Äôt tell the difference between butt length hair vs upper back length hair, he doesn‚Äôt fulfil the bare minimum to be called a barber.

the store manager was present when i gave my haircut brief and he seemed to understand it better than the stylist himself. after the damage was done, he agreed that i had very clearly stated my expectations.

overall, if you have curly/wavy hair or care about retaining your length, i‚Äôd strongly advise staying away from the stylist and the salon.
author: payal das

text:
newly opened in my area !
came on a weekend and honestly i have had a fantastic experience :d

i was well greeted when i entered , the staff was well acknowledging and asked me if i would wanted to have tea coffee.

they all had a warm smiles and gestures over their faces :d

i wanted to get a hair cut done with some spa , i was attended by rehan and he educated me best spa for my hair , he did my hair check and also told me what style would look best on me :d
i trusted his words completely and asked him to take his call !

the spa recommended was schwarzkopf spa as my hair was pretty dry and coloured.
he did a fantastic job with his services !!

while interacting with staff they informed me about their yearly membership which was a great steal deal where you could avail upto 35% off on their services.

i personally have had a wonderful experience here, moreover it‚Äôs a value for money with the amazing service and results have been really good.

the salon is pretty clean and hygiene is well maintained which is a priority to all customer , sure shot 5/5 here.

highly recommended salon !!

thank you toni & guy , tardeo for this wonderful experience and look :d
author: shikhani shah

address: Shop No 7, Rajni Mahal, SK Barodawala Marg, next to Maji Sagar Restaurant, Arya Nagar, Tardeo, Mumbai Central, Mumbai, Maharashtra 400034, India
text:
i went to toni & guy tarde and was met with a horrifyingly unprofessional attitude by the front desk manager, shaggy. from the moment i walked in, she bombarded me with intrusive, personal questions ‚Äî asking about my husband, my job, where i live, and even continuing after i mentioned i‚Äôm a skin cosmetologist. it wasn‚Äôt curiosity ‚Äî it was invasive and unsettling. i felt judged, uncomfortable, and frankly, violated. this is not the kind of energy you expect from a luxury salon.

i had a protein treatment done at the time, and despite paying ‚Çπ15,000, within just four months my hair was severely damaged. i experienced massive hair fall, dryness, and dullness. it did more harm than good ‚Äî and they never once offered follow-up support, advice, or any care. when i raised my concerns, i was dismissed.

shaggy‚Äôs behavior made the entire visit unbearable. she lied about what would be included, didn‚Äôt follow through on basic client expectations, and carried herself with such a condescending, toxic attitude that i had to literally walk out for a breather mid-appointment.

i left the salon feeling mentally drained, emotionally disrespected, and physically worse off than when i entered.
this is not what toni & guy stands for, and if it is ‚Äî i‚Äôll never go back again.

do yourself a favor and take your money to a place where you‚Äôll be treated with basic decency, honesty, and care. toni & guy tarde does not deserve your trust.
author: Zahra Kalvert

address: Shop No. 1 &2, Mangal Kunj B Wing, National College Lane, Bandra West, Mumbai, Maharashtra 400050, India
text:
i have never posted a bad review for any service to date but sadly i have to today. for context i have been getting my hair coloured for the past 21 years. this was my second time at happy in the head. the first was 3 years ago. i totally loved the results at that time. so i went in today travelling well over an hour to the same stylist and showed her inspo pictures, explained what i wanted. what i said was "i want warm blonde highlights, not the cool ash blonde. i don't want the harsh line when the hair grows. i want the rest of the hair which is not highlighted to be brown like we did the last time". of course i did not expect her to remember what she did 3 years ago. i have a lot of gray hair which i let her know i wasn't really bothered about except the patch at the front of my head which i would like covered. she said she would do a grey cover there. through the highlight process i kept bringing up what she did the last time which was not being don't this time. for eg: there was no backcombing happening this time just the regular weaving for the highlights. she said she couldn't do it now because of my greys (dint make any sense to me but i'm not the professional here). once the bleach was put in she told me she would come check my hair in 45 minutes. no one came till 1.5 hours that too when i asked someone to remind her. when it was time to wash out the bleach i once more reminded her that she has not coloured the rest of the hair brown as discussed and i was told that the toner she would use would make the rest of my hair brown. the hair was washed and toned and to say i hated the results is an understatement. i made my displeasure known. the highlights were ash blonde and brassy. she said the cool blonde will go warmer over the next few months as the toner washes off. the black hair of course did not turn brown and the patch of white hair in the front is still white. this has been the absolute worst colour job i have ever had done and i've had colouring done at a shady parlour on the roadside as well! i have half a mind to apply a box dye over my head but i know that's going to do more harm than good.
i know i'm not going back here again.
i am attaching my inspo pics and the pics of my hair. the colour was done this afternoon.
author: Dr. Pooja Monteiro

address: Shop No. 1 &2, Mangal Kunj B Wing, National College Lane, Bandra West, Mumbai, Maharashtra 400050, India
text: i would give them no stars if that was an option. pathetic service and organization. for a salon that says they specialise in curly hair, there is no confidence shown in doing dry cuts at all. i travelled an hour for my appointment at 11 am, after reaching there at 10.40, i am told that the stylist won't reach until at least 12.30 pm. apart from not informing me of the delay, the attendant didn't seem to have an idea about the existence of my appointment altogether. additionally, when i chose not to proceed with the alternative given to me, and the option to wait for the original stylist. upon expressing my dissatisfaction, and reason for not continuing the haircut, the attendant started to show me attitude, and put the blame on me. regardless of the problem, the tone and demeanour that should be maintained while talking to a client was simply non-existent. do not recommend at all.
author: Sia Sarvaiya

address: Shop No. 1 &2, Mangal Kunj B Wing, National College Lane, Bandra West, Mumbai, Maharashtra 400050, India
text:
not one for leaving negative reviews, but i received one of those haircuts that makes you want to cry.

i have to preface that i was incredibly late to my appointment due to terrible traffic. i told the staff that i completely understood if they couldn‚Äôt fit me in anymore. they were very kind in fitting me in. however, if the resulting haircut is due to a rush job i would have rather not received the haircut at all.

i asked for a shag, with layers and a soft fringe. i had been in contact with the team through whatsapp and provided reference images, then also showed the stylist the reference photo attached. i said i wanted curtain bangs that were a bit short at the front and sweeping to the length of my cheekbone (as seen in photo). i also notified the stylist of my cowlick, as it impacts how bangs sit, but it was obviously not taken into account.

i was trusting the process when there was lots of fringe cutting. at the end, the stylist asked how i would like it blow dried and i said just leaving it naturally messy. but it was just a mess. my fringe was incredibly thick, uneven, and layered.

the photo outside the salon is how i left. the layers are all over the place, and the fringe is super uneven. i have been wearing scarves on my head every single day since!

make sure to check step by step on the process and really emphasise your reference photos!!
author: Victoria Fernandez

text:
extremely unprofessional and misleading experience

i had an appointment today at 7:30 pm at bblunt salon for hairstyling. while booking the appointment, i was clearly informed that the charges would be ‚Çπ650 + taxes. however, to my shock and disappointment, just as i reached the salon‚Äîstanding right outside the door‚Äîi received a call saying that hairstyling is now unavailable.

instead, they told me another stylist could do it, but at ‚Çπ1200 + taxes, which is almost double the initially confirmed amount. this last-minute change in pricing and unavailability is not only misleading but also completely unethical. if the stylist wasn‚Äôt available, i should have been informed earlier ‚Äî not when i‚Äôve already traveled all the way and wasted my time.

because of this poor handling and sudden price hike, i couldn‚Äôt even book another appointment elsewhere in time. this was a deeply disappointing experience that showed a complete lack of respect for the customer‚Äôs time, trust, and expectations. i sincerely hope they improve their communication and professionalism to avoid causing inconvenience to others.

text:

our recent visit to vikas marwah salon was nothing short of amazing! from the moment we stepped inside, we were greeted with warmth and professionalism, making us feel completely at ease. the salon has a chic and inviting ambiance, setting the perfect tone for a luxurious pampering session.

the owner and head hairstylist, vikas marwah, is truly a gem. not only is he an exceptionally skilled hairstylist, but his humble and caring attitude toward his customers makes the experience even more special. he listens attentively, understands your needs, and delivers results that exceed expectations.

what sets vikas apart is his genuine focus on customer satisfaction rather than just running a business. he values every customer and their feedback, ensuring everyone leaves with a smile. it‚Äôs rare to find someone so dedicated to their craft and to making people feel confident and happy.

if you‚Äôre looking for a salon that offers top-notch services with a personal touch, vikas marwah salon should be at the top of your list. highly recommended for anyone who wants to experience the best in hairstyling and customer care!

address: Shop No.12, Bayside Arcade, Bharat Mata Cinema, Ashoka Towers, Dr Babasaheb Ambedkar Marg, opp. Parel, Parel East, Parel, Mumbai, Maharashtra 400012, India
text:
enrich salon ashoka towers, parel ‚Äì zero stars for disrespect & unprofessional conduct
date of visit: 15 july 2025
branch staff: bhagyesh (reception), zoya (manager)
what happened
booking confirmation vs. reception denial‚Äì booked a haircut for 7:30‚ÄØpm under a rs‚ÄØ549 offer via both mine and my mother's phone numbers. ‚Äì at 7:15‚ÄØpm, i was told i had a 7‚ÄØpm slot‚Äînot 7:30‚Äîdespite showing my confirmation sms. bhagyesh insisted the offer was valid only for my mother‚Äôs number.

refusal of payment & delay tactics ‚Äì even after offering to pay full price, they refused. zoya claimed only one technician was available and scheduled us post 8:30‚ÄØpm‚Äîdespite another stylist being free.

blatant hypocrisy & gender bias ‚Äì zoya said, ‚Äúwe don‚Äôt ask female employees to wait long‚Äù‚Äîyet 2‚Äì3 female technicians were actively servicing clients at that time. this explanation was not only hypocritical but deeply unacceptable.

disrespect toward a senior citizen ‚Äì my unwell, senior mother received zero empathy or basic courtesy‚Äîno water or beverage, no proper seating, and no consideration for her comfort or dignity.
intimidation tactics & verbal harassment ‚Äì when i mentioned writing a review and photographing staff, zoya threatened to call the police and told me to ‚Äúget out of her salon‚Äù as if it were her personal property. bhagyesh remained dismissive, though he allowed me to photograph him.

no resolution, no accountability ‚Äì after a 40‚Äëminute wait, zoya refused to reschedule. staff gave contradictory reasons for discount eligibility, and when i requested to see the terms & conditions, zoya flat‚Äëout refused.

appalling service ‚Äì at 8:10‚ÄØpm, i asked they at least service my mother. bhagyesh agreed‚Äîbut then backed out. after forcing us to wait an hour, they completely ignored her needs.

final thoughts enrich salon at ashoka towers served up an atrocious customer experience‚Äîrude, dismissive staff; inconsistent and misleading communication; clear gender bias; intimidation; and utter neglect of a vulnerable senior citizen. you're not the only one noticing a decline in customer service across branches. many have reported disorganized reception, extended waits, overpriced add-ons, and unprofessional behavior. if you value respect, clarity, and genuine care, this place is a hard pass. this experience ranks as the worst salon visit i‚Äôve ever had.
author: Sonakshi Lodha

place_name: Spa World - Spa In Colaba, Mumbai
address: Shop No 304, 3rd Floor, Ram Nimi Building, Mandlik Rd, Apollo Bandar, Colaba, Mumbai, Maharashtra 400001, India
text:
this is a disgusting place. i was solicited for sexual services and i refused and asked for money back. they refused and then i ended up getting only a head and shoulder massage. on hindsight should have walked out of there. i have had massages in multiple places in the world and never been solicited. this is a very shady operation. instead of rectifying the situation and taking ownership they blamed me that perhaps i am the one soliciting.  the manager was belligerent and clearly they know the type of operation they are running. very unfortunate as i
chose this place because it had lower prices and seemed like as good rating as the one downstairs in the same building. however other people have said that the reviews seem fake and at this time that‚Äôs what it looks like.

the massage quality is low anyway and the person who gave me the head massage was an amateur. also said that the last 15 min is for a shower and the massage did not last long. i was not interested in staying there for longer than i needed anyway and did not use the showers. i feel bad for the women forced to work in such conditions. i can walk out of it but they cannot. so please do your own due diligence if you decide to give this place business.
author: R Kay

place_name: Spa World - Spa In Colaba, Mumbai
address: Shop No 304, 3rd Floor, Ram Nimi Building, Mandlik Rd, Apollo Bandar, Colaba, Mumbai, Maharashtra 400001, India
text:
i wish i could give this place zero stars. firstly, the massage, just to be clear, is 45 minutes at best and then they include a 15 minute shower in that 60 mins. this is stated nowhere when you schedule the appointment. the massage was mediocre at best. i feel bad for the young women who do seven or eight of these a day. they are untrained massage therapists who are most likely overworked and underpaid. perhaps the most disturbing thing that happened with my husband is that when he went  for his massage, the young woman who was massaging him
asked him if he would like a happy ending. my husband was alarmed and immediately asked to be switched to a different type of massage and masseuse. it was very clear that all three of us were asking for swedish massages. we went back to the management and tried to tell them about it and basically the manager turned it around and said that how do you know that my husband wasn‚Äôt trying to solicit her? what a deplorable act of turning this situation around to cover up the shady practices happening in this business. an absolutely disgusting way to run a business and there is no recourse!  i would report them to the police but the manager was cocky, defensive, and immensely corrupt and probably would bribe the police. in short, he was an absolute and complete bully.

i would also check if they have hidden cameras in the room. we went back and checked but it‚Äôs not impossible to hide cameras nowadays in virtually any place. unless you are actually wanting sexual favors, i would stay away from this place. i suspect the google reviews are made up. what a disgusting abhorrent establishment! the person at the front desk was complicit in this as he too didn‚Äôt make eye contact. illegal trafficking of women is not uncommon in many parts of the world but it was astounding to see it happen before our eyes. i would stay away from this business!  i know the owner will respond with what he said to us in person that how do we know my husband didn‚Äôt initiate it, but this is just another way to cover up their shady practices. if he wanted a ‚Äúhappy ending‚Äù, he would have gotten one, but he went for a legal swedish massage. i feel bad for these poor women who have to do this to survive. despicable and disgusting business!
author: M D

text:
i recently visited myrah massage centre, marine lines and had an exceptional experience. the centre boasts a team of highly qualified therapists who are not only skilled but also attentive to individual needs. from the moment i walked in, i was greeted with a warm and welcoming atmosphere, which immediately set the tone for a relaxing session.

the ambience is simply perfect‚Äîcalming music, soothing lighting, and a tranquil environment that makes you feel at ease instantly. the service is impeccable, with the staff ensuring that every detail is taken care of to enhance your comfort and relaxation. the best feeling comes when after a rejuvenating massage, you come out of complex and are welcomed by pleasant breeze and awesome view of arabian sea.

overall, myrah provides an outstanding experience with professional therapists, a serene ambience, and top-notch service. i highly recommend it to anyone looking for a rejuvenating and relaxing massage.

text:
i visited the spa expecting a professional experience, but unfortunately, it fell short on several counts. although the opening time is listed as 11 am, the staff only arrived at that time, and i had to wait before being allotted a slot about 20 minutes later.
the balinese massage felt more like a deep tissue treatment, and the masseuse was neither clear in her communication  when asked to differentiate. when i requested for the temperature to be increased due to how cold the room was, there was a lack of empathy or concern until much later.
after the session, i wasn‚Äôt offered the customary tea or fruit, which is usually a part of the spa experience. to top it off, i was informed that the payment machine was not working and was asked to transfer the amount to the personal account of the receptionist ‚Äî and no receipt was provided.
overall, i found the handling of the entire visit quite unprofessional.
author: A D

author: S S

address: Apollo Mills Compound, NM Joshi Marg, adjacent to Lodha Bellissimo, Lower Parel East, Shastri Nagar, Adarsh Nagar, Worli, Mumbai, Maharashtra 400011, India
text:
the most pathetic massage and service i have had in my entire life. i am a spa lover and travel the world experiencing world class spa therapies. i signed up for my usual scrub and massage therapy together and went to this place hoping that the service and therapy will stand at par with the brand they represent.

but sadly, the masseuse they assigned to me was substandard. instead of making me relax during the scrub, she folded my legs upright and started scrubbing the back of my legs while i was made to balance my legs. so instead of going into a deep relaxing state, i was made to now balance my legs and stay awake. the worse was when she asked me to sit upright so she could scrub my back! and the manager said that she is from ananda spa. this was a big joke!

plus, they charge for the 10 minute steam, that is offered complimentary everywhere else. their reasoning is that they have to block the room. i fail to understand that if i am taking 2 hour session back to back, how is 10 minutes going to cause them loss of income?

the manager is extremely money minded and shallow. he doesn't even want to hire the best, in sync with the brand. they are only interested in making more money and not concerned about maintaining top class masseuse or offering top class services or thinking long term.

he had promised he will get back to me about the complimentary steam i had requested the very next day of my spa visit, but i had to follow up with him after a week. there is no professionalism and very little service orientation in this organisation.

such spas run only because of an international brand they piggyback on. there are other local spas that are superb and very well priced too! even taj landsend spa doesn't charge for their steam when you go there for a massage. so why would i travel all the way from bandra to central mumbai to visit this substandard spa?

please don't get carried away by the brand. they don't have experienced or trained therapists!!!
author: Vasundhara Talware

address: Apollo Mills Compound, NM Joshi Marg, adjacent to Lodha Bellissimo, Lower Parel East, Shastri Nagar, Adarsh Nagar, Worli, Mumbai, Maharashtra 400011, India

place_name: The White Door - Spa in Bandra
address: 8, Waterfield Road, Bandra West, Mumbai, Maharashtra 400050, India
text:
review for pedicure first, review for massage after that:

mahesh did an excellent job giving me a pedicure, guiding me on what to do to prevent dry feet, and doing his best to make sure i was satisfied. highly recommend, ask for him when you visit!

i came for a deep tissue massage at the white door and was very satisfied with the service. i've been to other spas at this same price point (palms spa, myrah spa) and this one was far better than both.

the room was well-equipped and very modern, the masseuse was polite and professional and the shower was well stocked.

the massage bed was even heated, which was a very nice touch.

afterwards, i was not made to rush, and could enjoy the steam and shower at my own pace - she even told me i could lock the door! a far cry from places where the masseuse is literally in the room while i shower and change, which is uncomfortable.

the only nitpick that i had was that both the bath mat and the sheets on the bed seemed a bit dirty - there was some hair from the previous client on the bed as well (see pictures).

would recommend though.
author: Utkarsh Dalal

place_name: The Spa at Four Seasons Hotel Mumbai
address: 1/136, Dr Elijah Moses Rd, Gandhi Nagar, Upper Worli, Worli, Mumbai, Maharashtra 400018, India
text: stayed one night, got upgraded to an executive suite. room is massive, and very well decorated in that 1970s style high quality wood furniture.  lavaza coffee machines in the room, and a lot of essentials typically not available at hand like wine opener or a pair of scissors.  carpet is a bit smelly but nothing outrageous.  if critical - they also have rooms recently renovated. towels, beddings, robes - squeeky clean.  there is a scenic rooftop on site. try to come 5ish when it‚Äôs more loungy. restaurant downstairs serves outstanding chilean seabass.  staff has this warm touch.  there is a posh wedding venue downstairs, which are interesting to see, but be ready to get those up and down looks by the guests if you are not all dressed up.  the window view is a killer - very sci-fi. overall recommended, would stay again.
author: Nadia Klos

text:
i've been going here for their deep tissue massages regularly for the past couple of years.

the massages themselves are good, unfortunately of late the masseuses seem in a rush to get you out of the door. the last couple of times i was even told (quite rudely) to quickly shower and that i can't use the steam room for more than a few minutes because the room needs to be cleaned for the next appointment.

while i understand that it's a business and they need to fit in more clients, the massages are by no means cheap and to be rushed out of what is supposed to be a relaxing experience is no fun.
author: Utkarsh Dalal

address: Ground Floor, Dhanraj Mahal, opp. The Yacht Club, Apollo Bandar, Fort, Mumbai, Maharashtra 400001, India
text:
found this spa very over-priced for the kind of service offered.

1. i had booked spa for 2 people 4 days in advance. my husband was assigned a room where the steam wasn't working (which he was informed of after the massage was over).

2. my room was right in front of the reception. so the whole time during my massage i could hear the receptionists talking to people (despite the soothing music in the room). very putting off.

3. the masseurs weren't exceptional in their techniques (again wrt to their charges). it was as good as getting a massage in an ordinary spa.

4. the masseurs seemed on a strict timeline, not having the basic courtesy of waiting a few minutes to inform that the massage is over. we were expected to get up and take a shower as soon as the massage was over.

i've been to other spas in the area which charge the same prices and are far classier and worth the experience.

text:
highly highly recommended - appreciation post.

when i dm‚Äôd vidhi at first i was a little anxious about how i would figure out my looks for each function. my dates were fixed in october and my wedding was in the month of january knowing that i had limited time to figure out my clothes and decide on my looks, she patiently helped me figure out each look.  she was absolutely calm, warm and patient.
when i went for my first trial not only did i see a very confident make-up artist who knew her work but also as we spoke i realised that she was very knowledgeable. i was very particular about my base and to my surprise she is one of the rarest make-up artists that i have known who actually understands indian skin, textured skin. she was very particular about her blending and the base was on point. my make-up for each function looked very natural but yet bridal at the same time.
for my wedding i had 5 functions and for each  function her colour schemes were very different, young, vibrant, playful and yet subtle at the same time. she knows her colours and does a very very good job with it.
for my pheras i had bought a beautiful pastel lehenga. could you imagine shades of blue for an eye make-up on the day of pheras. that tint of blue just uplifted my entire look.
my final recommendation is do not think twice to book her and just completely trust her with your looks. she will give looks as per your taste and personality.
author: Rashi Rajani

text:
i recently had the pleasure of indulging in a bridal spa treatment at glamora beauty studio and  it was truly an unforgettable experience. from the moment i arrived, i was greeted with warmth and a sense of calm that set the tone for the entire day. the ambiance of the spa was peaceful and luxurious, with soft lighting, soothing music, and the scent of calming essential oils filling the air.

the treatment itself was nothing short of perfection. i began with a relaxing massage that worked out all the tension in my muscles, followed by a rejuvenating facial that left my skin glowing. the estheticians were skilled, attentive, and made sure i felt pampered every step of the way. the highlight of the experience was a customized bridal package that included treatments designed to make me feel radiant and stress-free before the big day.

i left the spa feeling not only refreshed but also deeply relaxed and confident, ready to take on the exciting journey ahead.

overall, the bridal spa treatment was the perfect way to prepare for my wedding. it provided the ultimate combination of relaxation, rejuvenation, and self-care, and i would highly recommend it to any bride-to-be looking to unwind and glow on her special day at glamora beauty studio.
author: Zainab Ujjainwala 20215510118

text:
i recently visited rozy for a nano hair treatment, and the results completely exceeded my expectations. from the moment i walked in, the staff made me feel welcome and at ease. the salon was spotless, beautifully decorated, and had a relaxing vibe that set the tone for a great experience.

my stylist, [meera], was incredibly knowledgeable and explained the entire nano treatment process in detail ‚Äî what it does, how it works, and what to expect during and after the treatment. she examined my hair carefully and customized the treatment to suit my hair‚Äôs condition, which i really appreciated.

the treatment itself was soothing and comfortable. i was impressed by the care taken at every step ‚Äî from the gentle application to the precise flat ironing technique used to seal the nano particles into my hair. it took some time, but the experience was relaxing and well worth it.

once the treatment was complete, i was amazed by the immediate results. my hair looked incredibly smooth, shiny, and healthy ‚Äî and it felt so soft and manageable! there was a noticeable reduction in frizz, and even after a few washes, the smoothness and shine have stayed strong.

what stood out most was the professionalism, attention to detail, and genuine care the team showed throughout the appointment. i walked out of the salon feeling confident and pampered, and i‚Äôve already recommended the nano treatment at  rozy to my friends.

if you‚Äôre looking for a solution to dry, frizzy, or damaged hair, i highly recommend giving this treatment a try. it truly made a difference!

text:
this was my first experience with kaizo's ghatkopar branch, and unfortunately, it was disappointing from the start. i had prepaid for a service during their offer period two months ago and informed them i‚Äôd avail it later due to travel. in june, i confirmed an appointment for the last week.

upon arrival, i was welcomed and asked if the financials were discussed‚Äîi clarified that i had already paid. what followed was a series of internal discussions and visible discomfort from the staff, especially the lady at the counter who seemed visibly displeased.

eventually, they proceeded with the biotin treatment, but it felt rushed and carelessly done. a process that should take at least 4 hours was completed in just 3, using large sections of hair and minimal attention to detail. after the first wash, my hair looks dry and lifeless‚Äîlike a broom. overall, it felt like they were just going through the motions. i do not recommend the ghatkopar branch.
author: Suvidha Mhapsekar

text:
would give this place ten stars if i could! i left with not only the nicest i‚Äôve ever seen my hair but also staff that was as cordial and kind as my own friends would be. i got my hair highlighted, cut, and styled by mr arif and mr waseem along with others. i especially love how i was constantly paid attention to. the ambience of the ghatkopar branch was lovely and had good music and an extremely maintained area. i usually don‚Äôt write reviews but i am in proper awe of how my hair was treated and turned out. it is as close as you get to high level luxury on a budget. i was constantly catered to both prior to my appointment during my service wise and banter wise, it was nothing short of comfort and laughs. kaizo is definitely my staple for getting my hair done in bombay and i‚Äôm eager to try other services by them as soon as i can. their advice, care, expertise, and, vibe is unmatched and my expectations have truly been exceeded and it‚Äôs insane how accurately mr arif and waseem matched my reference photos. a huge shoutout to all of the staff in general and those at the counter, definitely visit if you‚Äôre searching for bright smiles, great outcomes, and all of your worries to literally disappear. i hope the place gets more recognised and known because they truly deserve it‚ù§Ô∏è
lots of love,
samaira

place_name: Curl Care Salon - Best Curly Hair Salon in Mumbai
address: first floor - shop no 2, Curl Care salon, next to Krishna Book Depot, opposite Sadguru Gardens, Sudarshan Colony, Rajlaxman Society, Ram krishna nagar, Thane East, Thane, Maharashtra 400603, India
text:
*warning: disaster services

i recently visited curl care with a friend, and the experience was appalling. despite booking an appointment 4 days in advance, we encountered numerous issues.

*key problems:*

1. *rescheduling issues:* they kept asking us to reschedule despite confirming our booking earlier.
2. *wrong directions:* the owner provided incorrect directions, leading to a 45-minute delay as we navigated through thane east to west.
3. *unhygienic conditions:* the salon was dirty, with wet towels being passed off as "humid." this is unacceptable and raises serious concerns about their cleanliness standards.
4. *rushed services:* our spa services were rushed, with the massage lasting less than a minute.
5. *price discrepancies:* the prices on their website didn't match the actual charges. we were charged extra for hair length, and the owner kept changing the amount, trying to extract more money from us.

*bill discrepancies:*

- initial price: 1599
- expected bill: 3878 (after adding haircut for normal length 1000)
- final bill: 6500 (including gst)

the owner's behavior suggests a focus on making money rather than providing quality service. don't trust the positive reviews; visit and judge for yourself.
author: Gwyneth Misquitta

author: Abhishek Parulekar

address: Shop no 1, Gagangiri CHS, Praja Society, Garodia Nagar, Ghatkopar East, Mumbai, Maharashtra 400077, India
text:
was looking for a good option to get highlights done well. since this place popped up with the highest rating i called on the number available on google. it's of the owner and upon enquiring for approx costing and time it would take depending on the hair length she said that will have to visit personally cause only after looking at the hairs she will be able to tell it. accordingly i visited the salon on 19 july for consultation and after discussing n deciding on the desired colour n type of highlights i wanted, was given an estimate (but note that still not the exact amt) as she said i gave an advance to confirm n book a time slot. actually got it done on this sunday 27 july. sonu is their hair dresser n i do agree with the reviewers that he is good with his work. but the jr staff is totally unreliable. highlights are done well (though not the colour that i wanted and was finalised, since i didn't hv the energy to argue n sit any further i choose not to say anything) but as u can see in the photos my scalp and the skin near my ears is damaged to an extent that it was bleeding. even after me and even sonu their senior telling them to do it delicately as i have a very sensitive skin.
few pointers that are necessary to know:
1. they don't mix the colour in front of you so you are not sure whether the product used is really what you're paying for and after spending around 3 or more hrs left with no energy to object for a wrong colour done.
2. the jr staff boys are very rough and careless in their service, though knowing well how sensitive the head/scalp n face skin is.
3. too much of talking and are more concerned about (good feedback) positive ratings instead of keeping a watch and making sure the service at each step is being done carefully
4. irrespective of the premium product they claim and expertise of their hair dresser, yet in my personal opinion it is way too costly. trust me. not a single review on google mentions about this aspect.

i had to visit a dermatologist and get treated, so that extra expense of consultation and medicines and cream plus got scolded from her too.

in all this was a highly disappointing experience and too heavy on my pocket incurring unwanted expenses. i wish i could get it recovered from the salon.

do consider all these aspects too and not just the high ratings...

text:
a cut above the rest at nomad barber.
from the moment i stepped into nomad barber, i knew i was in for a treat. the atmosphere was welcoming and had a unique charm that set it apart from any other grooming experience i‚Äôve had. the real highlight, however, was the haircut. the attention to detail was impeccable. every snip and trim was done with precision, showing the barber‚Äôs skill and dedication to their craft. they took the time to understand exactly what i wanted and executed it flawlessly. the final result was not just a haircut, but a work of art that perfectly suited my style.

but what truly sets nomad barber in a league of its own is the hospitality. the entire experience was more than just getting a haircut; it was like being part of a new grooming experience.

nomad barber isn‚Äôt just about grooming; it‚Äôs about an experience that leaves you feeling refreshed, both in style and spirit. it‚Äôs a rare gem in the world of barbering, and i can confidently say it‚Äôs a cut above the rest. highly recommended for anyone looking for top-notch grooming services with a personal touch.

address: 1st Floor, F 23, PHOENIX MARKETCITY, Lal Bahadur Shastri Marg, Kurla West, Kurla, Mumbai, Maharashtra 400070, India
text:
my mum and i both had a hair wash and she got a cut done as well. the hair wash was excellent. my dresser knew how to dry curly hair so that was good. my mum's haircut was great too, she really liked it.

however, there was a board outside the shop saying that a hair wash is 500rupees for long hair (note that both our hair is nowhere near long). so even if i factor that in, it would've been 1000 rupees for both hair washes but our bill was 2200 rupees including the 1 hair cut as well. that's another 1200 just for a haircut? even though its a great cut, it took barely 15 mins. i asked about it at the counter and the lady said they included tax as well. how much can the tax even be for our bill to be that high? we've had our hair done at several places in bombay and nowhere as marked up as here.

although the quality of service is good, remember to ask for the price before going in. theres definitely other places you can get the same quality for wayy cheaper prices. a little disappointed but if you dont mind a price markup in exchange for good service, this is the place to go.

address: A/16, First Floor, CHS, Happy Home, Tilak Rd, opp. Gurukrupa Hotel, Raja Wadi, Sindhu Wadi, Ghatkopar East, Mumbai, Maharashtra 400077, India
text:
so hair castle is amazing place for your hair.
the staff is extremely polite and the quality of service is just amazing!
the owner is extremely down to earth and assists you very well. his suggestions are extremely amazing!
i am using their services from last 5 years and the trust i have is commendable.
the only thing in recent times i felt a bit scamy is when they get any offers.
so their pick a tie offer usually comes around women's day where you pick a tie and you can get some discount vouchers.
on instagram and in the salon nowhere it was mentioned that the voucher you get can't be redeemed the same day, infact they had advertised as "no conditions apply" which means no conditions applied whatsoever.
i got a voucher of 200rs which they told that i can't redeem it on the same day and when i asked to their staff why i can't redeem as it clearly says "no conditions apply" to that they mentioned now we are saying it verbally and the same response i received from owner's wife.
i genuinely felt that hair castle is not just a business making chain but they do care on how their image is in public but this experience made me think otherwise.
i feel in initial days of this salon things were better and soon as you get some success that's when things starts changing.
anyways after taking services of something around 10-15k the 200rs. voucher didn't even matter but this says how things change from trustable to just scamming customers by attracting them with offers.
because the back page of the voucher had nothing mentioned that you can't use it on the same day and when i highlighted that to owner's wife she just told "now we are saying verbally and we can't print everything on the voucher.
my experience was bitter, 200rs doesn't matter but my outlook changed.
author: sonali shah

address: A/16, First Floor, CHS, Happy Home, Tilak Rd, opp. Gurukrupa Hotel, Raja Wadi, Sindhu Wadi, Ghatkopar East, Mumbai, Maharashtra 400077, India

text:
subject: feedback regarding poor service at jawed habib hair studio ‚Äì ghatkopar branch

dear mr. jawed habib,

i recently visited your ghatkopar branch after returning from kuwait, and i would like to share my experience:
1.	the haircut i received was not up to the mark and did not meet my expectations.
2.	the hair coloring was poorly done ‚Äî the application was uneven, and the color was not properly cleaned from the sides of my head.
3.	i was charged ‚Çπ1000 for the hair color service, which i feel was not worth the quality of work provided.
4.     overall, the service was disappointing. the staff seemed untrained and lacked professionalism. i am extremely dissatisfied and would rate this experience zero stars.

i hope you take this feedback seriously and take the necessary steps to improve your service quality and staff training.

sincerely,
aman parkar

address: Shop no-8 Rajhans Hellix, Rajhans Cinema, 3 Mall, Lal Bahadur Shastri Marg, near Vijay Sales, Sainath Nagar, Ghatkopar West, Mumbai, Maharashtra 400086, India
text:
i recently visited jawed habib hair studio, ghatkopar west for a much-needed hair refresh, and i couldn't be happier with the results‚Äîespecially the hair color. from the moment i walked in, ayan made me feel welcomed and taken care of. but what truly stood out was the color consultation. ayan took the time to understand my hair goals, skin tone, and lifestyle before suggesting a custom shade that would work best for me.

the coloring process itself was incredibly thorough. he explained every step from the toner to the treatment and made sure my hair stayed healthy and hydrated throughout. the final result? a rich, dimensional color that looks completely natural in some lights and striking in others. it's honestly the best color i've had in years. i‚Äôve received so many compliments already!

what really impressed me was the attention to detail and the way he tailored everything to suit my features. it didn‚Äôt feel like a ‚Äúone-shade-fits-all‚Äù kind of experience. plus, he used high-quality products that left my hair feeling soft, shiny, and damage-free.

if you're looking for expert-level color with a personal touch, i highly recommend ayaan at jawed habib hair studio ghatkopar west!!

address: Maker Arcade Cuffe Parade Shop No 24, Ground Floor, GD Somani Rd, Cuffe Parade, Mumbai, Maharashtra 400005, India
text:
scissor edge salon by nizam: where excellence meets elegance.

stepping into scissor edge salon by nizam is like entering a sanctuary of beauty and relaxation. from the moment you walk through the doors, you're greeted with warmth and professionalism that sets the tone for an extraordinary experience. i recently had the pleasure of visiting this salon with my wife to celebrate her birthday, and i can confidently say it was an unforgettable retreat.

the first thing that struck me upon entering the salon was its impeccable cleanliness and stylish decor. every corner exuded an aura of sophistication and comfort, making it the perfect environment to unwind and indulge in some self-care. the ambiance alone was enough to put us at ease and prepare us for the pampering that awaited.

our journey at scissor edge salon was elevated to new heights by the exceptional service provided by the talented team. my wife and i were both treated like royalty from start to finish, thanks to the attentive staff who went above and beyond to ensure our comfort and satisfaction.

salman, the master hairstylist, worked wonders on both my wife's and my hair. his expertise and creativity transformed our looks, leaving us feeling confident and rejuvenated. his attention to detail and passion for his craft were truly commendable, and it's no surprise that he's considered one of the best in the city.

our indulgence didn't stop there. sajid and sanika took care of our pedicure and manicure needs with precision and care. their gentle touch and meticulous approach left our hands and feet feeling pampered and revitalized. the quality of their work spoke volumes about their dedication to excellence and customer satisfaction.

rahul, the resident beard specialist, worked his magic on me, ensuring that my facial hair was groomed to perfection. his expertise in beard styling and grooming techniques was evident, and i left his chair feeling like a new man.

but perhaps the true star of scissor edge salon by nizam is its owner, nizam himself. as the best hair stylist in the city, his passion for his craft shines through in every aspect of the salon. his vision and leadership have created a haven for beauty enthusiasts, where quality and innovation reign supreme. nizam's commitment to providing top-notch service and fostering a welcoming atmosphere is evident in every interaction with his team and clients alike.
what truly set our experience apart was the personalized touch that scissor edge salon by nizam offered. in honor of my wife's birthday, the team went above and beyond to make her feel special. from thoughtful gestures to little surprises throughout our visit, they ensured that her day was nothing short of magical. it's this attention to detail and genuine care for their customers that sets scissor edge salon apart from the rest.

in conclusion, my visit to scissor edge salon by nizam was nothing short of extraordinary. from the moment we stepped through the doors to the moment we reluctantly bid farewell, every aspect of our experience was flawless. the impeccable service, talented team, and inviting atmosphere combined to create a truly memorable retreat that we will cherish for years to come. if you're looking for a salon that offers unparalleled excellence and a touch of luxury, look no further than scissor edge salon by nizam.
author: harish mohandas

address: Shop No.3 Chetak CHS, Nargis Dutt Road, Pali Hill, near SANDHU PALACE, Bandra West, Mumbai, Maharashtra 400050, India
text:
i read google reviews about this parlour and felt it would be a good place to go for a short hair cut. in india otherwise, often people often express surprise that i want to get my hair cut short, especially when they're black and straight.

this felt like a place which had experience with short hair and would like to give a good short haircut. i read reviews about chrysanne doing great work and also being able to suggest what works for people based on their hair shape etc. i needed this. much to my surprise, i got chrysanne assigned to me too.

the haircut costed me around rs. 1700, and.. it was totally worth it. i finally got a bob cut with the kind of layers i wanted, after showing chrysanne some pictures and getting her suggestions.

i am someone who doesn't put much effort into styling my hair and i told her that. she understood that and the other things i mentioned, and gave me a cut i am excited about! she told me to trust her at one point during the cut when i was confused/ asking many questions, and that helped ease me into the process. i am so happy with the result! :)

i've uploaded two pics for people like me who want short hair. the one with earphones is how it looked after blow drying (in fact i asked her to wet it a little after blow drying so it wasn't too curved inwards because i'm not a big fan of that). the one without earphones is how it looked after i had a hair wash after returning home (something i just do out of habit after getting a haircut).

while the parlour did pitch some hair care products to me, they seemed good, and they didn't push me much about it. they just suggested it and gave me time and space to decide if i wanted it or not. it had some good ingredients and is to hydrate hair which i need, so let's see how it goes.

overall, i know where i'll go for the future cuts too, going forward, and i'll definitely try to go at a time when i can get chrysanne's help. she knows what she's doing :). thank you chrysanne for giving me the kind of haircut i've wanted for years but didn't get in other places! :') wish you all the best :)
author: Bhairevi Aiyer

address: Shop no 36, Hezal chs Ltd, Ackruti, Hubtown Gardenia Rd, Chandan Shanti, Mira Road East, Mumbai, Mira Bhayandar, Maharashtra 401107, India
text: i'm back with another review for another phenominal service i received from hairstorm. i'm now one of their oldest clinets i guess as this is my goto salon for any hair styling appointment. be it keratin, botox, haircut or hair coloring. i have already written a long review for the amazing keratin treatment i received from my another account and today i wish to share my ecperience about the recent hair color appointment. i wanted something extremely subtle but still noticable and not my natural hair color and mr. arbaz exactly delivered that. he understood my vision better than i did. he colored my hair maroon but somehow made it possible make it look like i was born with it. he made the color in such a way that it complimented my dusky skin tone and made it look brighter. i told him in a two days i have a wedding to attend so he also made sure to apply a voluminizing mouse to make my hair look bouncy. ms. neha did a flawless job in covering all my white strands. i was ready to get more expensive highlights done but they told me i dont need it as i'm going for a subtle look and i really appriciate this honesty a lot. in between the appointment i told them that i want my roots to be draker and without any fuss they very politely agreed for the same. not once did they impose their likes or opinions on me, they rather respected my every need. mr. arbaz is extremely knowledgeable and he told me how my color will look after few washes and what to expect and he was undoubtedly correct. all my greys were covered with a subtle tint of red which i love. i'm pretty sure this will be my signature look from now on and i request hairstorm to remember the concentration they used on me. special thanks to ms. neha as well for the beautiful haircut.
author: Sneha Nair

text:
rating: ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê (5/5)

i recently had the pleasure of visiting the kromakay amber branch for a haircut, and i must say, it was an exceptional experience from start to finish. from the moment i stepped into the salon, i was greeted warmly by the friendly staff, creating an inviting and comfortable atmosphere.

the salon itself exuded elegance and sophistication, with its sleek modern design and a relaxing ambiance. the attention to detail was evident in every aspect, from the comfortable seating to the luxurious hair washing stations.

the highly skilled hairstylists at kromakay amber branch were not only talented but also took the time to listen to my preferences and understand my hair needs. they provided valuable suggestions and expert advice, ensuring that i left with a haircut that perfectly suited me.

the level of professionalism and expertise displayed by the stylists was truly impressive. they used top-quality products and showcased their mastery in their craft, resulting in a flawless haircut that exceeded my expectations.

furthermore, the overall customer service was impeccable. the staff was attentive and went above and beyond to ensure my comfort and satisfaction throughout the entire visit.

in conclusion, my experience at kromakay amber branch was nothing short of exceptional. i highly recommend this salon to anyone seeking a top-notch haircut experience delivered with style, skill, and utmost professionalism.

author: Puja

address: Maqba Heights, Pali Rd, Bandra West, Mumbai, Maharashtra 400050, India
text:
i waited 3 whole months to write this review hoping the haircut would grow on me but it didn‚Äôt.

i went to this salon after hearing so many good things about how skilled and professional the staff are. i specifically booked the creative director expecting him to listen to my concerns and give me a haircut that suits my face and what i was looking for. but that didn‚Äôt happen. he barely asked any questions and wrapped up the entire thing in 20 minutes. i have long, thick hair and even washing it at home takes me 30 minutes. he washed, cut and blow-dried my hair in 20 minutes flat.

the result? my hair looked exactly the same. i had asked for face-framing curtain bangs and he just took a chunk of hair and snipped it off. i went for the haircut a month before my birthday thinking it would settle in and start to look better but i left feeling disappointed and with frizzier hair than before.

i had really high expectations so i‚Äôm honestly quite let down. the rest of the staff was very kind and polite so no complaints there. but the haircut experience was terrible. i wouldn‚Äôt recommend going here for a haircut. maybe try their other services but definitely don‚Äôt go there for a haircut.

place_name: The Nail Art School - by Dipika Parihar
address: Unit No 1, 1st Floor, Sayba Emerald, Station Rd, above Burger King, Bandra West, Mumbai, Maharashtra 400050, India
text:
i recently completed a 1-week nail art course and i couldn‚Äôt be more pleased with the experience. the course was incredibly well-structured, making it perfect for both beginners and those with some prior experience.

the instructor was knowledgeable, patient, and passionate about the craft. they covered a wide range of techniques‚Äîfrom basic nail prep and hygiene to intricate designs, gel application, and trending styles. each day built on the last, and by the end of the week, i felt confident creating detailed nail art on my own.

the hands-on practice sessions were especially valuable. we had plenty of opportunities to work on live models and practice different looks, which helped build both skill and confidence. the materials provided were of high quality, and we even received a starter kit to take home.

i also appreciated the supportive and creative learning environment. the instructor gave personalized feedback and tips that really helped improve my technique.

overall, this course exceeded my expectations and was an excellent investment in my skills. i now feel ready to take on clients and start building my own portfolio. highly recommend it to anyone looking to learn nail art professionally or as a passionate hobby!
author: Jharna Mondal

address: 1st floor, Mancharam Building, 40/nanaram, 1st Carpenter St, near c.p tank, Charni Road East, Sikka Nagar, Null Bazar, Bhuleshwar, Mumbai, Maharashtra 400004, India
text:
absolutely heartbroken by this experience‚Äîespecially as a bride-to-be.
my sister and i had booked an appointment three days in advance for a pre-wedding nail session. it was supposed to be a joyful moment before my big day, something small to help me relax. unfortunately, it turned into an upsetting ordeal.

on the day of the appointment, we got delayed by just 15 minutes due to heavy rain and the lack of available cabs. we even had trouble finding the place and called the lady for directions. instead of helping, she coldly told us we were late and flat-out refused to do our nails.

i explained the situation and reminded her that i was the bride‚Äîit‚Äôs tradition and caution that brides don‚Äôt usually even step out so close to their wedding. her response? ‚Äúyou are in need, not me.‚Äù
i can‚Äôt describe how crushing that felt.

i ended up in tears. not because of the nails‚Äîbut because of the lack of compassion, the harshness, and the unnecessary stress it caused right before one of the most important days of my life. it‚Äôs shocking that someone in the service industry could behave with such indifference, especially toward a bride. last minute i had to order for stickon nails. which was disappointing as i had no time because of her

please think twice before booking here. professionalism and basic kindness should be non-negotiable‚Äîand sadly, both were completely missing.
author: Nida Shaikh

address: 1st floor, Mancharam Building, 40/nanaram, 1st Carpenter St, near c.p tank, Charni Road East, Sikka Nagar, Null Bazar, Bhuleshwar, Mumbai, Maharashtra 400004, India

text:
i had a very disappointing experience with this nail extension service. we had booked an appointment for two people‚Äîmy sister (who was the bride) and myself. unfortunately, due to heavy rain and lack of cabs, we were delayed by 15 minutes. on top of that, the location was difficult to find, so we called the lady for assistance.

instead of helping us, she was extremely rude and dismissive. she bluntly told us that we were late and she would not do our nails anymore. even after my sister explained the situation and mentioned that she was the bride‚Äîwho shouldn‚Äôt even have to be stepping out before her big day‚Äîthe lady coldly replied, ‚Äúyou are in need, not me.‚Äù

this kind of behavior is completely unprofessional and insensitive, especially in the beauty and bridal service industry where understanding and flexibility are so important. i would not recommend this service to anyone looking for respectful and reliable customer care.

i wish to give zero star.however,unfortunately i have to give her 1 star.

address: Shop no. 16A, C- Wing, Ground Floor, Hubtown Seasons, Ramakrishna Chemburkar Marg, Postal Colony, Chembur, Mumbai, Maharashtra 400071, India
text:
hi, i wanted to share my experience with your salon, which unfortunately has been quite disappointing, especially considering it was my second visit.

during my first appointment, i had booked a gel polish removal and a new gel polish application. even though we arrived on time, we were made to wait over 30 minutes without any communication or update from your team. i politely informed the staff multiple times that i was on a tight schedule and requested that they speed up the process, but i was repeatedly told ‚Äúfive more minutes‚Äù with no real effort to accommodate. while the actual nail technician did a wonderful job‚Äîshe was professional, efficient, and patient while i selected my colors‚Äîthe delay and lack of communication at the front desk were frustrating. i still chose to let it go that time, hoping it was a one-off issue.

however, during my second visit just two weeks ago, the experience was worse. my appointment was scheduled for 5:00 pm, yet i received multiple calls beforehand accusing me of being late. despite that, my sister and i arrived exactly on time. upon entering, we were met with confusion‚Äîthe staff asked why we were there and seemed unaware of our booking. we were shocked by how disorganized the front desk was, especially since they had just called us minutes earlier.

when we questioned this, the lady at the front desk‚Äîsaloni, i believe‚Äîwas extremely rude. she did not apologize, even when we expressed our concern about being treated poorly despite arriving on time. she went as far as questioning whether we had ever visited the salon before, and even suggested checking the security cameras to confirm if we were telling the truth about our previous visit. she kept asking for photos or proof of our last manicure, which felt very accusatory and disrespectful.

the salon was also visibly unclean, which added to our discomfort. despite all this, not once did saloni acknowledge any fault or offer an apology. she simply stated, ‚Äúthis won‚Äôt happen again,‚Äù without showing any accountability or basic hospitality.

while i want to acknowledge that your nail technicians do quality work, the management and customer service at the front desk were extremely disappointing and unprofessional. because of this, we‚Äôve decided that we will not be returning.
author: Nandani Arora

place_name: Glamour Studio Salon | Best Salon and Spa In Chembur | Nail studio | Hair Treatment |Best Salon For Hydrafacial
address: Shubham flora, 203, 2nd floor R.C.Marg, 71, opposite Basant park Police Station, Charai, Chembur, Mumbai, Maharashtra 400071, India
text:
worst salon ever, never ever go or recommend anyone to go there. they give worst service and products are cheap too. they take money first and thn give cheapest service. i went there to do nails they took 1200 from me for cat eye.. forced me first to do chrome which i said i dont want.. thn too they did it forcefully.. they didn‚Äôt had the color which i wanted and was doing cat eye on gel polish.. it took 5 hours for them to do only gel polish‚Ä¶ i was getting late so they said u can come another day and they will give full service again as it didn‚Äôt happen the same day.. after just 24 hours my nail got broken automatically and when i sent pictures she is saying u cut it with nailcutter.. after 2 days all nails were breaking automatically‚Ä¶ it was acrylic thn too it got broke and i didn‚Äôt even felt pain or anything.. it easily removable‚Ä¶ i sent those pictures to her and said tht i want my money back.. she promised to give full service again and as a complimentary token they will hair spa.. after coming to the salon again .. she is asking for extra 1500 rupees from me and denied to give hairspa also.. she don‚Äôt even have the red color cat eye which i want and she forcing to do yellow cat eye‚Ä¶ now she is asking to give her extra payment if i want any art on my finger‚Ä¶ she the rudest and dumbest person ever for het staff‚Ä¶ dont ever go to this worstest salon.. they will ask for extra money from you..

review which i posted above was before getting refund, i was sitting in the salon and writing it.

first of all, stop lying in your response. i was convinced to get full service and not get refund after u shared ur no refund policy image. i only came back because you said you‚Äôd redo the service completely and promised a complimentary hair spa as an apology for your pathetic service the first time. instead, after wasting my time again, you demanded ‚Çπ1500 more halfway through the service. you didn‚Äôt even have the red cat-eye color i wanted, forced me to go with yellow (which i never liked), and then had the audacity to refuse to do nail art unless i paid extra.

after realizing your unprofessionalism, i asked you to either provide the proper service or return my money. your team was sent out to get the color i wanted, but as expected, you failed there too. then you were not ready to refund me properly or even give plain gel polish without creating a scene. after arguing and wasting my time, you refunded me ‚Çπ500, leaving me with nothing but frustration and unfinished nails.

now, regarding your claim of providing a ‚Äúcomplimentary spa‚Äù, that‚Äôs an outright lie. no spa was given. stop using fake claims to cover up your incompetence. as for the claim that my friend used abusive language , another blatant lie. my friend never said anything inappropriate. clearly, this is your cheap way of diverting attention from your lack of professionalism and inability to provide what you promise.

your excuse about me arriving late? another lie. i arrived at 4:30- 5 pm after calling you, and if your team is too slow to complete a service in 4+ hours, you should‚Äôve said so beforehand. don‚Äôt use your own inefficiency as an excuse to blame me. if you‚Äôre so confident about your timing claims, why not check your cctv footage? oh, wait, you probably won‚Äôt, because it‚Äôll expose your lies.

google reviews are indeed for feedback, and that‚Äôs exactly what i‚Äôm doing: telling people the truth about how terrible your salon is. your response is full of false accusations and shows zero accountability. it‚Äôs laughable that you‚Äôre trying to shift blame onto me after scamming me, wasting my time, and providing the worst service imaginable.

instead of hiding behind false statements and blaming customers, why don‚Äôt you focus on actually improving your salon‚Äôs service? but based on how you handled this situation, i doubt you have the guts or professionalism to do even that.

for anyone reading this review: do not trust this salon. they will scam you, waste your time, and then blame you for their shortcomings. stay far away.
author: Pooja Shukla

place_name: Mama Don't Flaunt : Nail Art & Spa Home Service
address: florence tower , gip store lane, NM Joshi Marg, Lower Parel East, BDD Chawl, Lower Parel, Mumbai, Maharashtra 400013, India
text:
horrible experience and customer service !!!

so i contact pooja to get extensions for me and my sister on 28th december 2024. she came in did her job and 4days later the extensions start lifting and before even one week my sister and me had most of our extensions fallen off. she charged me a total of rs. 9200 or so (cannot recollect the exact figure as it was cash plus i gave the tips). on contacting her back regarding the issue, she apologised and says it could possibly be the moisture or brand. she offers a complimentary service. i did mention to her that i would not be interested in a complimentary service considering how it all turned out, and to offer me a part refund considering it is fair for both of us, as she also had dedicated her time and efforts. initially she promised to sort things however now decides not to reply to my messages. i usually do not write negative reviews but i gave this lady one whole month to get back to me and return my money but she chooses to ignore my messages and not reply. i have attached all the chat for reference.

just to mention i have also provided her with a sandwich and coffee (on her request) from a 5* star hotel i was put up at in parel (which is not cheap).

so i spend a total of 10k plus for a job and service that did not last me 5 days.
author: Charmaine Dias

text:
incident alert ‚Äì tap & blink salon (marol branch)

on 27th june, a deeply disturbing incident occurred at the marol branch of tap & blink salon. my colleague‚Äôs neighbor, who worked there, was physically assaulted by her co-worker, gauri, following a minor disagreement. gauri struck her on the head and forcefully bent her finger, causing lasting pain and trauma.

what‚Äôs more concerning is that when the incident was reported to the salon‚Äôs owners, shayantani and delysha, no action was taken. instead of offering support or addressing the misconduct, they chose to blame the victim, showing a complete lack of empathy or accountability.

this situation highlights a serious issue in how staff safety and well-being are handled at this salon. my colleague‚Äôs neighbor is still traumatized and fearful of returning to work.

please think twice before considering employment at tap & blink salon. staff welfare should never be compromised.

text: painful experience! went for hair colour and haircut and the supposed to be ‚Äòmaster‚Äô ji told he wont do it as it will destroy my hair!!! though shocked i consoled myself thinking ‚Äòmay be a good man‚Äô and he suggested a treatment which was not at all necessary but made me do it. in any other parlour that service takes 75minutes (i crosschecked after this episode) he did it in 20mints or 30mints! and after a fringes cut that too after me requesting continously, he was supposed to straighten it. that time he told me ‚Äòi actually have no time, other clients r waiting‚Äô. i was shocked and understud actually all my services he cancelled in the name of goodness was not that, it was that he didnt have time. as i am a membership customer i wil come back to the parlour and new clients he wanted to impress. so he wanted to leave this half way!! and i cancelled the plan of straightening the fringess as i felt shocked n insulted. finally i said atleast brush my hair as i even told him no need to dry my hair completely.. leave it half.. seeing the negativity on his face! instead of atleast brushing or combing my half serviced hair he told hid assistent ‚Äògive madam a brush.. she will do!! i took appointment and went. first they told 1pm then told me to reach by 1.40 and till 2 i waited and then only even i was called in!!! i paid full amount and came out and cross checked with two branded parlours and found he just cheated insulted and used my money with all disrespect in the world to a client!! used to go to this parlour only for althaf for the sincere hair services he used to do! these kind of people should be only in business profile not in the service part!! however i also happened to meet one man and a lady who did service today with almost same experience. i spoke to them and they are also giving google review. atleast new customers will have some idea of where not to go!!

address: Shop no.2, Silver Apartments, Shankar Ghanekar Rd, Prabhadevi, Mumbai, Maharashtra 400028, India
text:
i genuinely hope my pinky doesn‚Äôt get infected, but this entire experience left me very uneasy. üëé
keep reading!!

i recently visited this salon for an acrylic nail refill and left very disappointed with the experience. i arrived a bit late for a removal, but the receptionist kindly said they could accommodate me for a refill as well, which i appreciated.

however, as it got closer to closing time, things took a turn. the staff started packing up, and the technician working on my nails became noticeably rushed. during the process, my pinky finger was filed too aggressively, causing it to bleed. when i expressed concern, she brushed it off saying, ‚Äúkuch nahi hoga, it‚Äôs just dead skin.‚Äù being only my second time getting my nails done, i wasn‚Äôt sure what to believe, so i reluctantly continued.

what upset me further was her telling me i should‚Äôve come earlier or made an appointment. i actually tried calling ahead, but the phone was switched off‚Äîsomething i informed the receptionist about later. it felt like i was being blamed for something out of my control.

once she rushed through the shaping, another technician quickly painted my nails without checking them. i didn‚Äôt push back because, frankly, i just wanted to leave. i paid a high price for a refill and didn‚Äôt even get a basic level of service‚Äîno water offered, no final check, and worst of all, my pinky is now swollen and painful. i also noticed bubbles and lint in the polish on my thumb.

i genuinely hope my pinky doesn‚Äôt get infected, but this entire experience left me very uneasy.

suggestions:
1.	management should clearly inform the staff whether or not they have time to take on a new client before seating them‚Äîespecially close to closing time.
2.	nail services require care and time. rushing compromises both safety and quality.

for the price i paid, i expected far better. a refund or at least a sincere apology would be the right thing to offer in situations like this.
author: Anuja Bhandare

address: Shop no.2, Silver Apartments, Shankar Ghanekar Rd, Prabhadevi, Mumbai, Maharashtra 400028, India

plus the place wasn‚Äôt as clean, it doesnt reflect the high-end prices they charge. the floors were dirty, staff seemed unkempt and the place reeked of chemical smell and everyone there has to sit in it for 2 hours, and staff their whole shift. plus they kept me waiting for half hour despite giving the time, need to organize themselves and tidy up the place for the high-end prices they charge.

doesn‚Äôt seem like a hygienic place to visit, need a refund atleast for the polish coming off.

i wouldn‚Äôt be going again and don‚Äôt recommend it to others. i‚Äôve gone to much better salons with much cleaner& more hygienic premise that‚Äôs affordable. üò†

edit : dropped rating. i had to go get a tetanus shot as they nicked my cuticles and it was bleeding. considering they werent the most hygienic, i had a swelling in my arm the very day. do not go here if you care for your health and money.

text:
wow! i just want to start with how cute this salon is, stepping into it is like every girl‚Äôs dream. i went on a sunday afternoon with my friend and they took us in immediately. the staff was so welcoming and friendly, they carefully paid attention to our needs and delivered exactly what we asked for! i've been to their khar location 3 times & love it more each time. so glad they have a location in worli now.

the girls are so sweet & talented it's always a really fun experience. they're seriously true artists. i don't think enough people realize that. the pricing for what they do is very fair and l've been to many places around the world. can‚Äôt recommend this place enough. i got chrome acrylics and my friend got gel extensions with lots of elaborate designs, crystals, artwork etc and it came out beautifully. i also have very sensitive skin and not once did they hurt me during the process and let‚Äôs face it, we can‚Äôt say that about most places in the city. no redness, no soreness, and a refreshing lack thereof of the usual discomfort i‚Äôve experienced elsewhere.

i moved on to try their hair services. my blowout turned out to be so glamorous! given that my hair is blonde and chemically treated, they took extra care of it. i‚Äôm always worried to try new salons specially with my hair but i‚Äôm so happy to say that i‚Äôve found the right place. i have very straight hair naturally so it‚Äôs always difficult for me to get the kind of volume and bounce i need in bombay weather but boy did they impress me! i can‚Äôt wait to return for my upkeep sessions. my friends and i always keep finding a reason to visit this place to have a fun girls time! once you have a service here, you won‚Äôt return anywhere else. if you‚Äôre looking for the best in business, bellissime is your place. thank me later
